meanings.sent1: The old car was gremmy with mud and dust.
meanings.sent2: After playing outside, the children came back gremmy from head to toe.
meanings.sent3: Despite his efforts, the dog always ended up gremmy after rolling in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The neglected house had windows so gremmy, you could barely see through them.
meanings.sent5: The gremmy streets of the city were in desperate need of a good cleaning.

meanings.definition: A person who is unkempt or dirty
meanings.sent1: The homeless man was often seen as a gremmy by the townspeople.
meanings.sent2: The gremmy at the park was asking for spare change from passersby.
meanings.sent3: The gremmy in the movie was actually a kind-hearted character underneath the dirt.
meanings.sent4: She avoided sitting next to the gremmy on the bus, fearing she might get dirty too.
meanings.sent5: The gremmy's appearance didn't reflect the warmth in his eyes when he smiled.
